title: About maokai.....
body: Alright im not a league veteran so im not going to make a long post flaming rito for their balancing but after looking at my team getting assassinated by a 3000 health maokai i wonder if maokai is at all a healthy champion....

replies.body: Fun fact: Maokai is totally busted right now and is probably going to get a few mall nerfs.

*small 

i dont know what mall nerfs are  ?
That's where the slowly nerf out the diversity of a kit and add more clothing/skin options in the store.

maokai is maokai ... he has 4 cc abilities really good sustain and ok in almost any team comp. 

he does have weakness ... and as a maokai main i do expect there will be a tweaking of his Q in all honesty , riot has already made mention of it... to either lower his damage and /or cd on Q .. 

i argued against that change and i think the change that needs to happen is the mana cost on Q so he has to be selective when to use and not to spam it so much 

also cinderhulk * if he is jungle* really strong , good on all tank junglers ... it gives 20% bonus hp.  the hp it gives plus the 20% bonus hp  directly impact the power of his passive and sustain . in the same post i argued the purposed changes to maokai's Q i argued the real issue is the cinderhulk bonus HP and how it scales with all HP ITEMS
Yeah im not exactly having fun playing againts maokai or cho with cinderhulk
i dont know what champs you play ... but if you have one you play into /or main and face maokai alot as a maokai main i can give you pointers on how to deal with the match up

maokai shits on shen, in lane ... faster clear in jungle , shen has more global presence with ult and better team fighter 
best bet as shen is to use your ult to make tp plays 

kindred if you can get ahead and get to bork might have a chance , but due to the way they changed her stacks its a harder match up. counter jungle or invade him to get an advantage 

nidalee maokai cant really keep up with if you were to do cat like things cuz of your mobility. you have to get kills on the laners create pressure unless you have a clear advantage you arent likely to kill him 1 vs 1 

reksai would be your best team fighter in your champ pool. could go tank and still do damage

but out of win rates vs maokai kindred is the best with maokai having a 46.46% win rate in this match up. but the advantage here is your dps like i said he wants to be a tank, bork, and armor pen would be your best friends
yeah i miss the old kindred passive, do you know any hard counter to maokai?

people think counters come from individual match ups and yes this can be true to a point... but the counter is picking a team comp that beats the enemy's strengths and exposed their weaknesses 

for example you are facing tanks? why pick an adc who is gonna build lethality. 

or a jungler who builds lethality? 

if you are facing a team that has burst/assassins a hyper carry melee like yi you need hard cc and to shit on him as a team comp you arent beating him by yourself. 

people wanna make this game into a competitive 1 vs 1 solo game to show their skill when its a competitive team game. if you watch pro games and the picks/bans team comps and how they structure this and counter pick etc it would more insight that 1 champ vs 1 champ dont win or lose game its a whole comp and how they work together. 

as far as vs maokai... you need two damage dealers that can shred a tank... you need someone to keep him from being the engager and lock him down so your damage dealers can shred him. 

kindred is good vs maokai for the bork/black cleaver build he goes with blood razor cuz thats a lot of dps and % hp damage and armor pen/shred and if he engages upon you and your team your ult helps if you play it right. 

but picking kindred in jungle means you give up something in your comp that has to be made up else where. she is a range carry in jungle who can turn into a hyper carry 

but you have no cc, no tankyness, no engage/peel etc so somewhere in your team you need these factors. top? support? mid might have cc and some peel but typically not alot, adc really dont some have some utility 

this is where the fault of solo queue and non team play lies... people pick whatever they feel they are best at or want to play so shit like team comps and playing around it etc kinda goes out the window
and because most have this mentality of SOLO CARRY instead of TEAM WIN you get every one playing for themselves instead of picking and playing as a team. 

and this is a clear difference in play at pro level and the rest of us
damn dude thanks for the explanation, il keep that in mind

also keep in mind play a champ like a maokai kinda buffers you room for mistakes and are slightly forgiven due to the nature of the champ and build 

if you were to make the same mistakes on a different class of champ you would have some really glaring deaths 
and in a game where the team who makes the least mistakes and dont get punished as hard for them usually will win... sometimes its not about the plays you can make its about the mistakes you dont make
